oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Recognizing and Managing Infectious Causes of Lameness in Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Guard, Charles
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lameness
economic loss
anestrous
culling
low milk production
delayed conception
emergency slaughter
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lameness in cattle is a common condition that can result in significant economic loss to a producer through a variety of mechanisms. Lame cows do not eat as much as healthy cows and thus produce less milk or less gain. They may become anestrous. Furthermore, they may be prematurely culled due to low milk production, delayed conception or emergency slaughter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1994; 80-82
